definition: to scrape together enough (people, money etc)
to gather together, pool or collect/to happen by chance/to move close to/to exploit an opportunity
excessive
foot/to be sufficient/ample

sentences.english: We still need $ 5 to make up the sum we asked for.
sentences.chinese: 我们还需要5美元才能凑足我们所需要的数目。

sentences.english: A: We can‘t split open a case to fill your order .
sentences.chinese: 因为我们不能拆箱来凑足你的订量。

sentences.english: Funds were found and, armed with a wealth of enthusiasm, mother and daughter started out.
sentences.chinese: 资金终于凑足，怀着满腔热忱，母女俩出发了。

sentences.english: B:You bet,as long as I can collect enough money.
They made up a four at tennis.
sentences.chinese: 他们凑足了四个人来打网球。

sentences.english: You bet, as long as I can collect enough money.
sentences.chinese: 只要能凑足钱款，我当然愿意。

sentences.english: Because want happen by chance sufficient this word number or the theme that want more abstruse place.
sentences.chinese: 因为要凑足这字数还是要比较深奥点的主题。

sentences.english: We need one more player to make up a team.
sentences.chinese: 我们再需要一名队员就能凑足一个球队。

sentences.english: But it is very difficult to gather a team of players together.
sentences.chinese: 但是要凑足一队球员是很难的。

sentences.english: Don't wait until you have all the money needed before you start taking steps towards starting a business.
sentences.chinese: 不要等到你凑足所有的资金才开始你的商业投资。

sentences.english: We finally dug up enough money for a computer.
sentences.chinese: 我们终于凑足了买电脑的钱。

sentences.english: A: We can't split open a case to fill your
sentences.chinese: 因为我们不能拆箱来凑足你的订量。

sentences.english: Now call on others to sing K, even one in the box who can not gather sufficient.
sentences.chinese: 现在请别人去唱K，连一个中包厢的人也无法凑足。

sentences.english: Some actors recognised him and raised enough money to get him back on the tour.
sentences.chinese: 有一些演员认出了他，并凑足了钱让他回到了巡回赛。

definition: to collect all the bits to make a whole
to put together/to make up (a set)/to round up (a number to a convenient multiple)/resulting in...
assembled at random/a motley collection
to make uniform/to even up/to make good a deficiency
to raise enough money to do sth/to pool money/to club together (to do sth)
taking everything into account (idiom)/when all is said and done
to achieve with difficulty/only just up to the task/barely adequate
to plan out/to prepare
to raise (money)
altogether/in total
to collect money/to raise funds
at hand/within easy reach/convenient/handy
to serve as a stopgap/to make up a shortfall in the number of people
hundred thousand
to pay in advance/to get payment in advance
to meet together/to assemble (of a group of people)
